title: Ticket #5931: Inefficient JobRouter updates
description:
Updates are pushed from the job router to HTCondor-CE schedd in the following manner: 
for each job:
  connect to schedd
  set effective owner
  setattribute (with ACK)
  disconnect

This results in a huge number of connects / disconnects. Even worse - each 'connect' also causes a parse of the .schedd_ad and the job_router is also connecting via the condor_shared_port, adding more latency.

It should be possible to do this in bulk - hoist the schedd connection outside the for loop and reuse it for each job.
remarks:
2016-Sep-29 13:04:09 by bbockelm:
Oh - and obviously, it would be better to do the job updates in NoAck mode. That's not the first-order cause of delay right now, however.
